text:
AirAsia India confident of posting profit from December onwards Published on : Saturday, September 5, 2015
AirAsia India is confident of posting profit from December onwards after incurring a net loss of Rs44.15 crore (RM28 million), AirAsia Bhd Group Chief Executive Officer, Tony Fernandes said.
When asked on AirAsia’s unit in India he said, “When you start an airline, you’re not gonna make money in the first year, so we have predicted to make losses.”
AirAsia India last year registered a revenue of Rs115 crore (RM73.02 million) for the three months to June 30, 2015.
AirAsia India started its operations in June and flew over 300,000 passengers in the quarter.
However, Fernandes was confident that the unit would be profitable in December.
“But now we are confident of making profit in December, and 2016 is also going to be a good year for us,” he said after launching AirAsia’s latest route, which is Kuala Lumpur-Goa, India on Thursday.
On its latest destination, he said Goa ‘is an amazing place to visit and AirAsia is proud to be the only airline that connects Kuala Lumpur directly.’
AirAsia will fly three times weekly to Goa from Kuala Lumpur starting Aug 27.
It is offering a promotional base fares from as low as RM12 one way, which can be booked from now until Sept 6, 2015 for travel period from Sept 7 until Nov 30, 2015.
The introduction of e-Tourist Visa on Arrival by India for 113 nationals including Malaysia would encourage more tourists to visit India, said Fernandes.
Hence, he was confident of the potential of India for AirAsia and the airline is planning to connect four more cities from Kuala Lumpur, namely Coimbatore, Madurai, Delhi and Bhubaneswar.
